title: Wetherspoon to become first UK pub chain to tell punters how many calories contained in their booze - Mirror Online
text:
Wetherspoon to become first UK pub chain to tell punters how many calories contained in their booze How many calories are in a pint of Stella or a glass of red wine? Wetherspoon is to become the first pub chain in the country to tell punters how many calories their drinks contain. 
Many food chains already tell customers how many calories are in the meals they sell. 
But now the low-cost pub is to make sure they know just how much they are consuming when boozing too. 
Health bosses have long warned that alcohol is a significant factor behind rising levels of obesity. A pint of Stella Artois has 227 calories (Photo: Getty) 
Studies have shown alcohol is often followed by overeating. 
Many people are also unaware of how many calories are contained in alcoholic drinks. 
A pint of Stella Artois has 227 calories and a pint of Guinness 204. 
Red wine is not much better, containing 198 calories in 250ml of Malbec 
White wine is marginally less calorific, with a glass of Chardonnay containing 178. 
A man needs an average of 2,500 kcals per day while a woman needs 2,000. 
The new calorie information will be rolled out in new menus at Wetherspoon next month, according to The Sun. Like us on Facebook
